matrix

Interface BasicMatrixInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MatrixOperationsInterface

    public interface BasicMatrixInterface
    This interface defines fundamental Matrix operations such as setting and retrieving individual elements and obtaining the Matrix dimensions. Matrix indices start with 1.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getElement(int row, int column)
      Method to return the value at a specified element in the Matrix.
      int getNumColumns()
      Method to return the number of columns in the Matrix.
      int getNumRows()
      Method to return the number of rows in the Matrix.
      void setElement(int row, int column, double value)
      Method to allow the setting of individual Matrix elements.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        Method to return the number of rows in the Matrix.
        Preconditions: None.
        Postconditions: The number of rows in the Matrix is returned.
        Throws: None.
        Returns:
        The number of rows in the Matrix.

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        Method to return the number of columns in the Matrix.
        Preconditions: None.
        Postconditions: The number of columns in the Matrix is returned.
        Throws: None.
        Returns:
        The number of columns in the Matrix.

      • getElement

        double getElement(int row,
                int column)
                  throws MatrixException
        Method to return the value at a specified element in the Matrix.
        Preconditions: row is the row of the Matrix, column is the column.
        The row and the column must be inside the matrix (indices start with 1).
        Postconditions: The double contained at the specified location in the matrix is returned.
        Throws: MatrixException if (rows or columns < 1) or (rows or columns > the valid range).
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the Matrix to get the element.
        column - The column in the Matrix to get the element.
        Returns:
        The value at the specified location in the Matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if (rows or columns < 1) or (rows or columns > the valid range-- the max size specified upon construction).

      • setElement

        void setElement(int row,
              int column,
              double value)
                throws MatrixException
        Method to allow the setting of individual Matrix elements.
        Preconditions: row is the row of the Matrix, column is the column, and value is the number to insert into the matrix.
        The row and the column must be inside the matrix (indices start with 1).
        Postconditions: The Matrix element is set to the specified double.
        Throws: MatrixException if (rows or columns < 1) or (rows or columns > the valid range-- the max size specified upon construction).
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the Matrix to set the element.
        column - The column in the Matrix to set the element.
        value - The value to be set into the Matrix.
        Throws:
        MatrixException - if (rows or columns < 1) or (rows or columns > the valid range-- the max size specified upon construction).
